runs.comm: short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot

short-arm pull, into, and he seems to have hit the rope on the full, but my first reaction is wrong. Takes this from short of a length, and languidly sends it over square leg. Hits the rope on the half-volley, so this will be four. I am stunned. This is given a six. Possibly a compensation for hitting into the wind and nearly making it
big wide outside off
short of a length, outside off, defended to backward point

keeps hitting into the wind. Gone. The last short-arm pull beat the deep midwicket to his left, and reached the rope on the half-volley, but this one isn't that well placed and has stood up in the wind. Simmons takes a smart catch the boundary. Can't say the same about the batting
short of a length, angling in, pushed into the leg side for a couple
bunted wide of short midwicket for one
gets turn first ball, beats him outside off
googly, comes in from just outside off, dabbed to point
full, flat and straight, pushed to mid-off
this is not smart batting at all. Shehzad knows the two men in the deep are long-on and deep midwicket, and he still goes long-on. All he manages to do is offer a low catch to Pollard at long-on
flat legbreak, on off, he lets it turn, then opens the face, and late-cuts it for four
flat outside off again. Hafeez plays the regulation cut this time, but can't beat point
and Amin gets four off the first ball he faces in T20Is. Gets a gift of a leg-side half-volley and clips it through midwicket
Amin's career strike rate stays at 400. Gabriel bowls a limp short ball, pitched outside leg, and has been pulled through leg. That short ball had no sting
short of a length, angling across, angling too far
short of a length, wide, punched away, but straight to short cover
short again, and Amin is expecting those gifts. Again not much venom behind the short ball. Dragged from around off, and through midwicket it goes
short of a length, accurate, defended back to him
length ball, wide outside off, angling away too. Called
short of a length, wide, punched away in front of square. Gayle makes a diving save at extra cover to keep this shot down to one run
googly. Pitches just outside leg, takes a leading edge, but doesn't carry back to Badree
shimmies down to take this on the full and smashes this high to the right of Badree. Beats his outstretched hand
googly, short, pitched outside leg, punched to long-on
legbreak, middle and leg, paddled to short fine for a single. Gabriel a touch sluggish there
length ball, no turn, middle and leg, played to square leg
short of a length, p[itched outside leg, pushed wide of midwicket for one
starts with a short delivery and a single to deep midwicket
carrom ball, short, wide, cut away, and misfielded by Gayle at point. poor cricket all around from West Indies on that delivery
sharp offbreak, cramps him up. I suspect Hafeez was playing for the straighter one. Inside-edged into the pad
calculated risk. Well done. Takes a length ball from wide outside off and sweeps it over square leg for four

looks like a soft dismissal but you can see what Hafeez was doing here. He picked the carrom ball, which shortish and widish. He tried to late-cut it, but failed to keep it down and cut him straight to short third man
short of a length, straighter one again, beats his cut
lovely shot. Down the wicket, takes this on the half-volley, and goes over mid-off. Doesn't matter which way it is turning if you get to the pitch of the ball
flatter, non-turner. Hits his pad
another good shot by Amin. He is down the wicket again, a bit too close to the pitch of the ball, but goes ahead with the drive, and sends it between the bowler and mid-off
short ball, Amin is expecting it, and rocks back to pull it over square leg for his seventh four. He has faced only 16 balls
quick legbreak, defended back to him
superb shot again. This is overpitched on off, and he has driven with this with an open face past Gayle at extra cover. And Gayle can't chase those nowadays
full and straight and quick. Defended from the crease
heaved away from outside off, gets a single to deep midwicket
length ball, pitched well outside leg, lucky to get away with just a leg-bye
driven inside-out, wide of mid-off, and Samuels gives good chase to keep them down to one
full and straight, pushed to long-off for one
short of a length, tucked into the leg side for one. This time Sammy misfields in the eagerness to go for a direct hit
wide and full, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, pitched outside leg, pushed to Samuels
another misfield. Driven over his head, straight of long-on, and this time Badree lets it through at long-on. At least two runs gifted
driven square for a single
short of a length, turning in, helped around the corner
quick offbreak, played back to him, but he wasn't in full control of that
Akmal goes after Best. He tried that last over too, but this time he goes all out. Gets under a length ball, and drives him inside-out over mid-off

Sammy - who else, really? - turns it around for West Indies in the field. You couldn't imagine any other man turning this lethargic fielding effort around. Short of a length, Akmal is deep inside the crease as he pushes this towards short midwicket. He still goes for the single, Sammy has about one-and-a-half stumps to aim at. He hits. Akmal is out
quick, short of a length, on off, and beats him with the angle
full, on off, runs off the outside half of the bat to third man
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
full and quick, outside off, worked into the leg side for one
flighted outside off, defended back to him
full and wide, steered out to deep point for one
sharp turn from short of a length and outside leg. Beats the outside edge and the off stump
quicker, pitched outside leg, hits the pad
quick full toss, hit back to Samuels. Momentum is shifting. Earlier Amin was hitting these for fours
down the wicket to drive this length ball to wide of deep cover for two
short of a length, Azam tries to pull. Mis-hits because this is not short enough
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-on for one
driven back at him on the up, but Sammy fields in his follow-through
driven in the air, but well short of long-off
length ball outside off, worked into the on side for one. Azam tries to play everything into the leg side
short of a length, on off, punched down to long-off

Samuels has got him. Amin has walked past one. Those easy boundary balls dried up, and Amin has thrown it away. Not sure he needed to. The asking rate was in control. Down the wicket to try to drive him wide of long-off, and doesn't reach the pitch of the ball, which turns past the bat to leave him stranded
is Afridi in a hurry to go swim in the sea? Down the wicket first ball, reaches the ball, and sends it sailing over long-off
lovely drive against the turn, but Gayle makes a diving save at extra cover to keep them down to one
paddled away to fine leg for one
superb shot. Afridi is ON today. Backs away, makes room, takes this on the full, and drives it past extra cover for four
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away for a single
short of a length, quick, on off, defended with an open face
moves across the line, right in front of stumps, and flicks a full ball to long leg
short of a length, quick, into the body, short-armed to long leg
short of a length, on off, he looks to work it with the angle, but gets a leading edge towards extra cover
comes forward to a shortish delivery and defends
length ball, outside off, pushed wide of short cover for a single
paddled away from outside off, gets a single to short fine
full, on the pads, bunted away for a single
carrom ball, outside off, opens the face to go with the turn, and takes a single
offbreak, tossed up, just outside off, defended with an open face
carrom ball, pitched outside leg. Afridi hasn't picked it, wants to let it go for a wide, but the ball turns and brushes his leg
driven inside-out, but Gayle makes a diving save at extra cover to keep them down to one
new spell, old loose balls. Short, without any menace behind it, and helped away over square leg for four
moves across the line to work a length ball into the leg side
length ball, angling into the pads, worked towards deep midwicket, and the threat of Pollard there keeps them down to one
poor bowling but good fielding. Well down the leg side, flicked away fine, but Badree makes a diving save at the fine-leg boundary to save two runs
backs way well in advance, shows him all the stumps, but Gabriel decides to follow him. Afridi pulls to deep midwicket for one

wicket No. 2 for Gabriel. Pollard does his bit in the field. Not the smartest of the shots. This is the highest short ball Gabriel has bowled. Azam is nowhere near being in control of it, but goes ahead with the hook. Pollard charges in from deep square leg, and takes a low catch diving forward. This has been a match of gifts and return gifts. Still going on
tossed up outside off, carrom ball, beats the outside edge
a little too full, pushed to deep cover for one
Afridi's international six No. 400. Down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball but goes ahead with the loft. It goes as high as it goes long, but clears long-on
carrom ball, quick, starts on off, beats the attempted dab. Afridi nods in acknowledgement
another quick carrom ball outside off, beaten again
Afridi keeps the strike. Stays in the crease to a length ball, opens the face, takes the single. Don't think this was the offbreak either
short of a length, outside off, steered away for a single
quick length ball outside off, squeezes under his bat to beat him
full and fast but too straight, and Babr alternates the strike again with a dink into the leg side

short of a length, angling in, Afridi gets inside the line to work it between deep fine and deep square. He nearly runs himself out by risking the second, but puts the dive in to make it. There is only half a frame there, though. And the throw was good and beside the stumps. Can't help but think a specialist keeper would have got him
lovely shot. Makes room, takes a full and fast delivery to drive it square, over point for four. Afridi is playing a blinder here
wide down the leg side. Dug in short, middle and off, but it then seams away down the leg side
length ball, outside off, played with an open face. Takes the single. No extra effort from West Indies to deny him that single, and with that strike at the start of the next over
half-volley outside leg, nicely placed wide of deep midwicket for two. A run a ball required now
on a length, on off, doesn't turn, played with an open face for one
Babar plants the front foot down, is beaten by the offbreak. Sammy catches at slip, but this has come off the pad only
carrom ball outside off, beats him, but West Indies still not getting that wicket
bat-pad. This offbreak takes the inside edge, hits the pad, lobs up in the air, but far enough from the keeper
oh what? A reverse-sweep. And connected well too. But can't beat Best at point. So excited is Babar he nearly runs himself out by going for the single that never is
big wide down the leg side, the diving Charles can only get a hand to it. That's three runs before a ball is bowled

Afridi is toying around with a bowler low on confidence. Plants the big front foot across, takes a length ball from wide outside off, and ramps this fine of short fine leg. Pumps his fist as soon as he sees he has beaten the fielder
short, down the leg side. Another wide

Gabriel gives Sammy the wicket, but is it too late? Length ball outside off, Afridi can see the end of the match there, and he goes hard at it. Except he gets too under it, and skies it towards long-off where Bravo calls early and Sammy stays away. Good fielding under pressure
accurate all of a sudden. On a length, on of, defended
another wide from Gabriel. Down the leg side again. Just not confident enough
short of a length, just outside off, played back to him. Babar opened the face to try to get a single, but ended up paying this back to SG
short of a length, outside off, Babr plays with an open face, but is beaten on the outside edge. Playing down the wrong line there. Sammy applauds
short, not too quick, pulled in front of square. Ajmal wants the second but Babar sends him back as Bravo is swooping in on it from long-on
that's the game. What a debut, sir. Babar has snatches this. Quick length ball on off. Samuels just darted it in. He drove, drove with an open face, and it cleared cover
another dart. This time a yorker. Clipped to square leg. No single available
darted outside off. Beats the big drive

scores are level. Afridi lightens up finally. Fired into the pads at 120ks, but they steal a leg-bye. Ajmal does his job by responding to the call. Sammy from short midwicket wants to do under-arm it, but Ajmal is between him and the throw. Ajmal hasn't changed his direction, though
the game is alive still. Ajmal drives and runs. Straight to mid-off it has gone. Simmons lets it rip, and finds Ajmal short. At least AJmal has given Babar the strike

oh Babar. What a debut. What a player. Samuels keeps darting them in, but this one is a low full toss, and Babar has got under this to clear the infield. What's more? This has cleared the long-off boundary
